ygData.subject: Re: Button Quest or "Death to Twisting" or How t
ygData.msgSnippet: I tried about a week ago when I was lost in the car to hit sense heading, so I know how you feel ... From: RON_TALBOT@HP-Cupertino-om5.om.hp.com
ygData.messageBody:
I tried about a week ago when I was lost in the car to hit sense heading, so
I know how you feel


-----Original Message-----
From: RON_TALBOT@...
<RON_TALBOT@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, August 02, 1999 5:02 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Button Quest or "Death to Twisting" or How t


>From: RON_TALBOT@...
>
> And I keep trying to click on the car in front of me and type
> /autofollow. (california freeways...) and don't even ask what I think
> when I look at my girlfriends cat...
>
>
>______________________________ Reply Separator
_________________________________
>Subject: [eqbards] Button Quest or "Death to Twisting" or How to ma
>Author: Non-HP-isalmen (isalmen@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
>Date: 8/2/99 10:03 AM
>
>
>From: "Ilkka Salmenkaita" <isalmen@...>
>
>> I know the interface will not support this right now. The interface
treats
>> bards like casters, but that does not mean they can't alter the interface
to
>> accomodate this request. Add a Harmony Ability (See Definitions below,
esp
>> #4a, courtesy of Meriam Webster's Online Dictionary). This "Harmony"
>> Ability could take the form of a button on the Abilities menu. The Bard
>> pushes the "Harmony" button and then depresses multiple songs in the
order
>> the Bard wants to play them. The Server then starts each song and
>> immediately shifts to the next song until the list is completed and then
>> returns to the top of the queue. To stop the auto-playing of songs, hit
the
>> "Harmony" button and resume manual control. Simple enough? The idea is
not
>> without precedent. [The auto-attack feature of the game is a similar
form
>> of redundancy elimination (which could also be enhanced, similarly to
what
>> is suggested here, to include special attacks like kick or bash or the
>> myriad Monk abilities).] There will be some resistance, perhaps even
>> philosophical rejection, to any form of scripting, but keep in mind that
>> this change would be completely voluntary for the user.
>
> Actually, though probably not something easily coded into the game,
>this is a great idea to reduce the twitch-a-mania bards face. Heck,
>nowadays when I am away from computer, I can see in my MIND the
>damn hotbuttons (2 and 3, I always keep selo and hymn there) and
>whenever I see people moving around or myself am walking, I am
>mentally pressing the 2-key. I can see it depress, and soon flashy
>balls around and thinking of moving faster =P I would not say I am
>addicted, I would say the damn keypressing has burned into my head!
>Though my gf probably has other notions about me not being addicted...
>Now to think of it.. just yesterday left her place at 11pm to go home and
>play instead of staying over (to you-know-what), so OK I am addicted.
>A bit.. not much.. just a bit =P
>
> - Ilkka Salmenkaita, isalmen@...
>
>
